document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the genus Eudonia Billberg, 1820 from China (Lepidoptera: Crambidae: Scopariinae)

Diagnosis.
Eudonia puellaris
Sasaki, 1991
is simialr to
E. albilinea
Sasaki, 1998
and
E. cavata
sp. n.
The differences between them are stated under
E. albilinea
and
E. cavata
.
Distribution. China (Chongqin, Fujian, Gansu, Guizhou, Henan, Hebei, Hubei, Jiangsu, Liaoning, Shaanxi, Sichuan, Taiwan , Tianjin , Yunnan, Zhejiang), Japan , Russia .

Remarks.
Eudonia puellaris
varies in the shape of uncus, gnathos and valva in the male genitalia. In most individuals, the uncus is convex slightly, but notched at middle on posterior margin; the gnathos is broad triangular with pointed tip; the ventral margin of valva is slightly convex at two thirds. But in some other individuals, the uncus is straight, without notch on posterior margin; the gnathos is narrow triangular with blunt apex; the ventral margin of valva is angled or slightly concave at about two thirds. This species is recorded for the first time in China .
